hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via Policy News Merger Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, following a major, unambiguous positive regulatory development (e.g., MiCA implementation clarity, US ETF expansion), if BTC price breaks above the upper Bollinger Band (20,2) on a weekly closing basis with volume > 1.5x 20-day average, this signals a transition to BULL regime, offering a long entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack a dominant narrative. A clear positive regulatory catalyst provides a fundamental driver for renewed risk appetite. A high-volume weekly close above a volatility-based resistance level indicates committed buying from larger participants, likely initiating a new trend.
entry_conditions: Major positive regulatory catalyst confirmed (news sentiment score > 0.7)
BTC weekly close > upper Bollinger Band (20,2)
Volume for breakout week > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 1.5x the Bollinger Band width added to breakout level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price re-enters Bollinger Band and closes below 20-week MA
exit_conditions.time_exit: 4 weeks without a higher high following breakout

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such breakouts result in a 'false breakout' (price back inside bands within 2 weeks) despite the positive catalyst.
